medical_history.chief_complaint: Right-sided abdominal pain and nausea/vomiting for 3 days.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms started when the patient woke up and had a banana and 2 Tylenol for ear pain. Pain developed progressively with upper abdominal pain and vomiting episodes, primarily of yellow bile. Right-sided abdominal pain intensified, leading to ED presentation after a night of worsening symptoms.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Obesity, history of cholecystitis with laparoscopic cholecystectomy, left ankle fracture, scoliosis; denies history of hypertension, asthma, diabetes, bleeding/clotting disorders.
